chav1961.purelib.fsys

Class FileSystemFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.fsys.FileSystemFactory

  • public class FileSystemFactory
extends Object

    This class is a factory for creating file system instances for the given URI type.

    All implementations of the FileSystemInterface are installed into the library by Java SPI mechanism. Every file system implementation need implements two constructors:

    • public default constructor
    • public constructor with the URI parameter

    The first constructor is a requirement of the SPI, but not uses by file system factory. File system instance was created with the given constructor, need support the SpiService.canServe(URI) method only and nothing more! The second constructor is the legal way to create file system instance. Any URI parameter for this constructor need be absolute, contains a scheme, and need contain all required information for creating file system instance (for example, database connection, user name and password string etc). The factory find all deployed classes (as described in Java SPI), and test the class about supporting URI with the given scheme. If class was found, the factory creates the class instance and return it

    This package implements a restricted set of file systems:

    • FileSystemOnFile - file system based on the native file system (location URI schema='file')
    • FileSystemOnRMI - file system as a client for remote server (location URI schema='rmi')
    • FileSystemOnXMLReadOnly - file system based on an XML file content (location URI schema='xmlReadOnly')
    • FileSystemOnFileSystem - file system based on standard file system mechanism in the Java 1.7 and later (location URI schema='fsys')
    • FileSystemOnCsvDb - file system provided access to database content in the CSV format via JDBC protocol (location URI schema='csvdb')

    Any vendor can add it's own file system implementation to the library. To make this, simply use SPI protocol. The reference to vendor file system need be described in the META-INF/services/chav1961.purelib.fsys.interfaces.FileSystemInterface file

    To use of the file system implementations, type:

    FileSystemInterface fsi = FileSystemFactory.createFileSystem(URI.create("fsys:jar:./myJarFile.jar"));

    URI scheme need be one of URI schemes described in the File System's list, or need be one of the vendor-specific ones. The scheme-specific part of the URI see descriptions of the appropriative File System implementations classes

    The class is thread-safe

    Since:
    0.0.1, last change at 0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    Java SPI description, FileSystemInterface, JUnit tests
